text: It would be pretty cool if you could set bounties on github issues, like "I will give 200 dollars if someone fixes this"

text: I see I see, I'm more so interested in offering small amounts for getting examples of packages than making money.

text: If you post a bounty, they'll ask you put up the money upfront, which is reasonable.. But if no one solves it, I think they keep the money, not refund it. I could be wrong, but that's how I understand it.

elements.text: If you post a bounty, they'll ask you put up the money upfront, which is reasonable.. But if no one solves it, I think they keep the money, not refund it. I could be wrong, but that's how I understand it.

text: It looks like if the issue gets closed without a fix then the bounty gets refunded (see <https://github.com/bountysource/core/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#what-happens-if-an-issue-ive-backed-is-closed-without-resolution|https://github.com/bountysource/core/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#what-happens-if-an-issue-ive-backed-is-closed-without-resolution>). Of course if it never gets closed...
